original_prompt:
summerize the following text in two sentences:
Jorge Sebastián Matías Lagües Suárez (born 22 January 1997) is a Chilean professional footballer who plays as a defensive midfielder for Chilean Segunda División club Rodelindo Román.

Club career
A product of Colo-Colo's youth system, Lagües made his Primera División de Chile debut on 4 January 2015 in a 1–0 home defeat against San Marcos de Arica for the Torneo Clausura. He was sent to the field on 81st minute replacing Jaime Valdés. Likewise, he was member of Colo-Colo squad which won the 2016 Copa Chile.

In July 2017, he was loaned to Deportes Valdivia. He made his team debut on 9 July in a 2017 Copa Chile match against Huachipato. He scored his side's goal in a 1–2 home loss. During the Primera B de Chile season, he made 13 appearances and scored two goals: a) the only one goal in the sixth week's 1–0 home victory over Unión San Felipe; b) his side's goal in the 2–1 away loss with San Marcos de Arica.

In 2020, he joined Rodelindo Román.

Honours

Club
Colo-Colo
 Copa Chile: 2016

References

External links

obfuscated_answer: Jorge Sebastián Matías Lagües Suárez, born in 1997, is a Chilean footballer who plays for Rodelindo Román. He began his career with Colo-Colo, had stints with Deportes Valdivia, and joined Rodelindo Román in 2020.
deobfuscated_answer: Jorge Sebastián Matías Lagües Suárez, born in 1997, is a Chilean footballer who plays for Rodelindo Román. He began his career with Colo-Colo, had stints with Deportes Valdivia, and joined Rodelindo Román in 2020.
original_answer: Jorge Sebastián Matías Lagües Suárez, born on 22 January 1997, is a Chilean professional footballer who plays as a defensive midfielder for Rodelindo Román in the Chilean Segunda División. A product of Colo-Colo's youth system, he made his Primera División debut in 2015, was part of the 2016 Copa Chile-winning squad, and has since played for several clubs, including a loan spell at Deportes Valdivia before joining Rodelindo Román in 2020.
